what: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
code: # S3 method for class 'OxCalResults' as.data.frame(x, row.names = NULL, optional = FALSE, ...)

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
text: x list returned oxcal_parse(). row.names character vector giving row names data frame description, NULL. optional logical scalar. FALSE names variables data frame checked ensure syntactically valid variable names duplicated. ... Currently used.

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
text: data.frame following columns: name  operation  type  date  error  agreement  convergence  likelihood  posterior

title: 14C Calibration with OxCal — oxcal_calibrate
text: names character vector specifying names dates (e.g. laboratory codes). dates numeric vector giving BP dates calibrated. errors numeric vector giving standard deviation dates calibrated. curve character string specifying calibration curve used.

title: 14C Calibration with OxCal — oxcal_calibrate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Calibrate 14C dates cal <- oxcal_calibrate(   names = c("X","Y"),   dates = c(5000, 4500),   errors = c(45, 35) )  as.data.frame(cal) } # }

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
code: oxcal_configure(   command = NULL,   os = NULL,   install = TRUE,   install_location = NULL,   install_url = NULL,   ask = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose") )

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: command character string specifying path OxCal directory. os character string specifying operating system workstation. must one "Linux", "Windows" "Darwin". NULL (default), operating system determined automatically (see Sys.info()). install logical scalar: OxCal binary found, downloaded installed? install_location character string specifying directory extract OxCal files . created necessary (see utils::unzip()). install_url character string specifying url OxCal installed. ask logical scalar: OxCal installed, user asked downloading ? verbose logical scalar: status updates displayed?

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: Downloads latest version Oxcal (needed) sets executable path correctly.

title: Setup OxCal — oxcal_configure
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
code: oxcal_execute(   script,   file = NULL,   mcmc = "MCMC_Sample",   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose"),   ... )

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
text: script character string instructions OxCal. file character string naming file (without extension) write script . Output files named file written directory. mcmc character string giving name output file MCMC samples (without extension). must match Name argument OxCal's MCMC_Sample() function. used script contains MCMC_Sample() command. verbose logical scalar: status updates displayed? ... parameters passed system2().

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
text: list class OxCalOutput containing following elements: oxcal character string giving path .oxcal file. js character string giving path .js file. log character string giving path .log file. txt character string giving path .txt file. csv character string giving path .csv file.

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

title: Download OxCal — oxcal_install
code: oxcal_install(   install_url = NULL,   install_location = NULL,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose") )

title: Download OxCal — oxcal_install
text: install_url character string specifying url OxCal installed. install_location character string specifying directory extract OxCal files . created necessary (see utils::unzip()). verbose logical scalar: status updates displayed?

title: Download OxCal — oxcal_install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
text: path character string naming JavaScript file data read (list returned oxcal_execute()).

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
text: list class OxCalResults containing following elements: ocd list OxCal data holds ranges, probability distributions, etc. parameter. model list information model. calib list information calibration curve.

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }
